channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: Life Kit's advice for handling conflict with neighbors
item.description: Trash, noise, parking, weeds â€” conflicts with neighbors are common. NPR's Life Kit has tips from a mediator on how to settle a dispute with your neighbor.

item.title: Scott Detrow reflects on covering the weekend
item.description: Host Scott Detrow shares his reflections about hosting All Things Considered on the weekend after more than two years.

item.title: Russia revives Soviet-era song contest
item.description: This weekend, more than 20 former Soviet nations competed at Intervision 2025. Putin revived the song contest after Russia was banned from Eurovision in response to its war in Ukraine.

item.title: Former Colombian guerrilla leaders convicted
item.description: In Colombia, former guerrilla leaders rebels have been convicted of mass killings and kidnappings but will serve no prison time. For victims, the verdict underscores how elusive justice can remain in the aftermath of war.

item.title: Mothman fever descends on West Virgina town
item.description: Locals and visitors celebrate the sighting of a red-eyed creature first spotted nearly sixty years ago.

item.title: On Palestinian statehood, the U.S. is out of step with allies ahead of global meeting
item.description: On Sunday, Britain, Canada and Australia said they recognized Palestine as a state. The Trump administration will find itself at odds with much of the rest of the world over Palestinian statehood.

item.title: NPR staff share their love for Nora Ephon's movies
item.description: Nora Ephron reshaped the romantic comedy, crafting films remembered with genuine affection even by men who rarely rank the genre among their favorites.

item.title: Glen Weldon's take on what to watch on TV this Fall
item.description: Glen Weldon shares his favorite series this fall, and details on the HBO Max show Task, Netflix's Long Story Short, and Apple TV+'s Pluribus.

item.title: A blind scientist explains her passion for understanding gravitational waves
item.description: Scott Detrow talks to Lulu Miller, the host of Radiolab's Terrestrials podcast, about her conversation with the scientist Wanda Diaz-Merced, who studies gravitational waves that ripple through spacetime.

item.title: Trump calls Charlie Kirk 'martyr now for American freedom' at memorial service
item.description: At a service focused on Kirk's conservative Christian faith, President Trump described the late 31-year-old as the "greatest evangelist for American liberty" as Kirk's widow forgave the alleged gunman.
